resources.string: My City
Categories
Attractions
%s Attractions
Detail
Back
music
"food"
historical and cultural
outdoors and nature
nightlife and entertainment
Grand Ole Opry: Iconic country music show featuring legendary and contemporary artists.
Ryman Auditorium: Historic venue known as the "Mother Church of Country Music."
Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum: Explore the history and culture of country music.
Bluebird Cafe: Intimate setting for singer-songwriter performances and storytelling.
The Listening Room Cafe: Live music and delicious food in an intimate, acoustic setting.
Tootsie\'s Orchid Lounge: Honky-tonk bar with a rich history and vibrant live music scene.
The Station Inn: Bluegrass hub with renowned musicians and a laid-back atmosphere.
Exit/In: Iconic music venue hosting diverse acts and bands since the 1970s.
The Basement East: Trendy spot for indie bands and a lively music experience.
Marathon Music Works: Versatile event space showcasing concerts and special events.
Mercy Lounge: Three-level venue offering a mix of live music and DJ nights.
3rd and Lindsley: Live music venue with a focus on local and national artists.
The Crying Wolf: Eclectic bar with live music, craft cocktails, and a relaxed vibe.
Bourbon Street Blues & Boogie Bar: Live blues music and New Orleans-inspired ambiance.
Belcourt Taps: Gastropub with live music, local beers, and a cozy atmosphere.
Hattie B\'s Hot Chicken: Famous for its spicy Nashville hot chicken.
Prince\'s Hot Chicken Shack: Historic spot known for its original hot chicken recipe.
Loveless Cafe: Southern comfort food and renowned biscuits.
The Pancake Pantry: Longtime breakfast spot offering a variety of pancake creations.
Rolf and Daughters: Innovative cuisine with a focus on locally sourced ingredients.
Husk Nashville: Farm-to-table Southern dishes in a historic setting.
Arnold\'s Country Kitchen: Meat-and-three cafeteria with classic Southern fare.
Biscuit Love: Popular eatery serving creative biscuit dishes.
Martin\'s Bar-B-Que Joint: Delicious barbecue with a variety of smoked meats.
Peg Leg Porker: BBQ joint known for its mouthwatering ribs and sauces.
Monell\'s Dining & Catering: Family-style Southern meals in a communal setting.
Germantown Cafe: Modern American cuisine in Nashville\'s historic Germantown.
The Southern Steak & Oyster: Upscale Southern dining with seafood and steaks.
Butcher & Bee: Creative sandwiches and small plates made from scratch.
Jack\'s Bar-B-Que: Downtown barbecue spot with a variety of smoked meats.
The Hermitage: Former home of President Andrew Jackson, showcasing history and artifacts.
Belle Meade Plantation: Historic mansion offering tours and insights into plantation life.
Frist Art Museum: Contemporary art exhibits in a stunning historic post office building.
Andrew Jackson\'s Hermitage: Preserved home and grounds of the 7th U.S. President.
The Parthenon: Full-scale replica of the Greek Parthenon, housing art and sculptures.
Cheekwood Estate & Gardens: Elegant mansion with art exhibitions and lush gardens.
Tennessee State Museum: Exhibits detailing the state\'s history, culture, and heritage.
Fort Negley Park and Visitors Center: Civil War fort with educational exhibits.
RCA Studio B: Historic recording studio where Elvis and others recorded hits.
Hatch Show Print: Legendary letterpress print shop producing iconic posters.
Printers Alley: Historic district with bars, music venues, and a vibrant atmosphere.
Civil Rights Room & Collection at Nashville Public Library: Archives documenting civil rights history.
Historic Second Avenue: Cobblestone street lined with shops, restaurants, and history.
Fort Nashborough: Replica of Nashville\'s first settlement and a glimpse into pioneer life.
Musicians Hall of Fame and Museum: Celebrates musicians from all genres and eras.
Centennial Park: Urban park with walking trails, gardens, and the iconic Parthenon.
Percy Warner Park: Picturesque park with hiking trails and scenic vistas.
Edwin and Percy Warner Parks: Two parks offering nature trails, golf, and equestrian activities.
Radnor Lake State Park: Nature preserve with trails and wildlife observation.
Shelby Bottoms Greenway: Riverside trails for biking, walking, and bird-watching.
Cumberland River Pedestrian Bridge: Iconic bridge offering views of downtown Nashville.
Nashville Zoo at Grassmere: Family-friendly zoo featuring animals from around the world.
Adventure Science Center: Hands-on science exhibits and interactive experiences.
Bicentennial Capitol Mall State Park: Historical landmarks and educational exhibits.
Nashville B-Cycle: Bike-sharing program to explore the city\'s neighborhoods.
Arrington Vineyards: Picturesque winery offering wine tastings and live music.
Cheatham Wildlife Management Area: Hunting, fishing, and wildlife observation.
Harpeth River State Park: Canoeing, hiking, and historic sites along the Harpeth River.
Moss-Wright Park: Playgrounds, trails, and historical structures in Goodlettsville.
Long Hunter State Park: Lakeside park with boating, fishing, and hiking.
Broadway Honky Tonks: Famous strip with lively bars and live country music.
Acme Feed & Seed: Rooftop bar and live music venue on Lower Broadway.
L.A. Jackson: Chic rooftop bar offering skyline views and craft cocktails.
The Patterson House: Speakeasy-style bar known for its creative craft cocktails.
Red Door Saloon: Local dive bar with a friendly atmosphere and live music.
The Bluebird Cafe: Intimate venue for singer-songwriters and acoustic performances.
The Sutler Saloon: Historic spot with live music, Southern food, and craft drinks.
No. 308: Trendy cocktail lounge with a unique and ever-changing menu.
The 5 Spot: Eclectic dive bar featuring live music and dancing.
Pinewood Social: Social club with bowling, cocktails, and inventive Southern fare.
The Station Inn: Bluegrass hub hosting legendary acts in a cozy setting.
Belcourt Taps: Laid-back gastropub with craft beers, live music, and patio seating.
Rudy\'s Jazz Room: Intimate jazz club featuring local and touring musicians.
Santa\'s Pub: Quirky karaoke spot located in a trailer, beloved by locals.
The Basement East: Dynamic venue showcasing indie bands and energetic performances.
